body.p: The has a number of extension points which can be implemented by other Eclipse plugins which depend on it. All of them are listed in the plugin.xml along with sample usage code. Below is a list with short descriptions for the most useful ones:

section.title: Extension point ditaKeyDefinitionManager
section.p: It can be used to provide an external keys manager responsible of providing DITA keys which are then used for editing and resolving referenced content. Its EXSD schema can be found in: OXYGEN_PLUGIN_DIR/exsd-schema/ditaKeyDefinitionManager.exsd.

section.title: Extension point actionBarContributorCustomizer
section.p: A very useful extension point which can add or remove actions from various menus, contextual menus and toolbars contributed by the . Its EXSD schema can be found in: OXYGEN_PLUGIN_DIR/exsd-schema/actionBarContributorCustomizer.exsd.

section.title: Extension point customEditorInputCreator
section.p: Create your custom editor input for a certain resource which will be opened by the when clicking links. Its EXSD schema can be found in: OXYGEN_PLUGIN_DIR/exsd-schema/customEditorInputCreator.exsd.

section.title: Extension point editorAdapterContributor
Extension point extensionsBundleContributor
section.p: Provide your own ExtensionsBundle implementation for a certain opened XML resource. Its EXSD schema can be found in: OXYGEN_PLUGIN_DIR/exsd-schema/extensionsBundleContributor.exsd.

section.title: Extension point stylesFilterContributor
section.p: Provide your own StylesFilter implementation for special visual rendering when an XML resource opened in the Author editing mode. Its EXSD schema can be found in: OXYGEN_PLUGIN_DIR/exsd-schema/stylesFilterContributor.exsd.

section.title: Extension point XMLRefactoringContributor
section.p: Contribute a folder which contains additional XQuery scripts which can be used by the batch XML refactoring actions. Its EXSD schema can be found in: OXYGEN_PLUGIN_DIR/exsd-schema/xmlRefactoringContributor.exsd.
